metadata.Title: CVE-2022-0216 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free vulnerability was found in the LSI53C895A SCSI Host BusAdapter emulation of QEMU. The flaw occurs while processing repeatedmessages to cancel the current SCSI request via the lsi_do_msgout function.This flaw allows a malicious privileged user within the guest to crash theQEMU process on the host, resulting in a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0216` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm2
qemu-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm2
qemu-guest-agent - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm2
qemu-keymaps - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm2
qemu-kvm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm2
qemu-system - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm2
qemu-system-aarch64 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm2
qemu-system-arm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm2
qemu-system-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm2
qemu-system-mips - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm2
qemu-system-misc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm2
qemu-system-ppc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm2
qemu-system-sparc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm2
qemu-system-x86 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm2
qemu-user - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm2
qemu-user-static - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm2
qemu-utils - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: qemu package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm2').
